result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per Jack / dispatch - Cory Wayman detained in Vilas

3:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cory H Wayman not in court. Calling 22CF49 & 22CF58. Court review of case. Pfeifer requests warrant be authorized. Court authorizes warrant. adj. 03:29 PM
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report

3:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cory H Wayman in court. Calling 22CF49 & 22CF58. Court review of case - Defendant is eligible for PD - still searching for counsel. Bond continued. adj. 03:36 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report

4:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cory H Wayman in court. 
Calling 22cf49 and 22cf58.
Defendant now makes a voluntary appearance -Court statement to history of case  -  warrants previously authorized quashed. (Not yet done)
Court questions defendant to non appearance and late appearance today. Defendant statement- had car issues.  Wasn't sure where to go once he was here so he left then called.  
Pfeifer statement to bail.  PD is still looking for counsel for Mr. Wayman.  Defendant statement.  

Court reinstates bonds
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cory H Wayman not in court. 
Calling 22cf49 and 22cf58.
Counsel still not appointed, but no appearance by def.  Pfeifer statement.  Court authorizes warrants.
Status of PD counsel - 45 attorneys contacted

3:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Cory H Wayman appeared in court. Calling 22CF49 & 22CF58. Court review of case - eligible for PD - still searching for counsel - will set out. Defendant statement to no contact. Court continues bond. adj. 03:39 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Cory H Wayman appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF58 & 22CF49. 22CF58 set for an Initial Appearance. 22CF49 set for a bail/bond hearing. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appearing by video - does qualify - conflict in office. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Defendant statement to non-appearance. Court questions Defendant on address/employment. Defendant on probation hold. Court sets bond in 22CF58 and reinstates bond bond in 22CF49. adj. 01:57 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
